content.description: The "Grotto" is located on the left side of the wall. Most of the route is 5.5 or easier with a couple of 5.6 moves. The "crux" comes just after you clip the 3rd bolt. Step up to clip the bolt then move up and slightly left of the overhang. For an easier time, clip the 3rd bolt then move right.
content.protection: Three draws is all you need. Although this route "sports" 3 bolts it is not "sport bolted". There's a bit of a runout between bolts but the runout portions are closer to 5.4 or 5.5 so it never actaully feels runout.
content.location: To find the start, look for the partially detached flake on the left side of the wall. Stair step your way up the flake to clip the first bolt.

content.description:
From the anchors you can top rope "Avoidance" on the right side of the slab or any of the real estate between "Avoidance" and "Grotto". Make up your own routes as you go!

The name was derived since the climb "avoids" the easier corner to the right of the climb and "avoids" the poison oak at the base.
content.protection: Currently a top rope. Pete Gulyash originally put in 2 bolts but they have since been removed (and not yet replaced).
content.location: Find your way to the anchor by climbing "Grotto" then set up a top rope.
